Though we’ll never be able to repay them properly, we owe so much for their sacrifices. So today and every day, we must honor their memory. 
 
My thoughts are with all those who have ever said goodbye to loved ones.

While they were heroes, they weren’t superhuman. They were young men and women with their entire lives ahead of them, who sacrificed the chance to pursue their hopes and dreams so that we can pursue ours.

Many of them hugged goodbye to partners, parents, and children who never got the chance to welcome them back. Others returned from service carrying emotional and mental scars from the battlefield—addiction, depression, or PTS.
This #MemorialDay, I want to take a moment to reflect on the men and women in uniform our country has lost—both on and off the battlefield.
